intro: Phlebochilus cairnsianus, commonly known as the Cairns' phlebocilus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in a dense, spherical inflorescence. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
